intro: Bellevalia macrobotrys subsp. macrobotrys, commonly known as the large-flowered bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It features basal rosettes of narrow, gray-green leaves and produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink to purple. The flowers are typically clustered in terminal racemes and bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine settings.
